employment.description: RBI hired me as a full-stack developer working on a user customisable dashboard with graphs showing big data collected from farming across the UK, Australia and the USA. the dashboard was built with React, Redux, Express for NodeJS, Elasticsearch, Git, Yarn. I was responsible for introducing new dashboard widgets (complete with front-end, back-end and Elasticsearch Querying) while also deciding with the team on the future of the codebase structure based on business goals.

I worked as a front end lead for Movivo's entirely React-redux SPA. The project involved building a dashboard that is capable of remote-controlling thousands of smartphones with a multitude of AJAX calls. Built using ES6 and unit testing with Jest and Enzyme. The project extensively uses Google B2B services, I was brought in to assure Movivo passed a Google review, which we did with ease.

Zone required a developer to quickly deliver two Umbraco modules for a pub chain client of theirs. They required a JavaScript photo-gallery slider built with Vanilla JS using ES6. they also required a React/Redux SPA that showed pub locations on input of postcode/town, managing multiple AJAX calls to RESTful APIs. The work involved close collaboration with .net developers and working to the specifications of existing JS solutions. Meticulous use of Git was key, along with a strong focus on cross-device compatibility.

Kagool (an award-winning digital agency) hired me to tackle a heavy workload with their roster of multi-million-pound clients. I worked on a variety of projects with: React, AngularJS, Sitecore, SASS/LESS, on cross-device compatibility and SEO practices (incl AMP & Google schema).

I worked with Immediate Media on an eCommerce platform for their new TV shopping channel that was launched in February. The site features a live auction with product information provided using sockets and AJAX calls to a RESTful API from AngularJS. Other disciplines used: HTML5, CSS3, WordPress & PHP.

I worked in Countrywide’s front-end team building a portal for their customers to buy or sell property. We had a fast turnover using SASS (with the Gridle framework), HTML, jQuery and GULP. I also worked on updating their internal bookings system using ReactJS and NodeJS (with Express).

Indesign Studio X required my services for various eCommerce site fixes and new features requested by their clients. I used JavaScript , jQuery , HTML5 , CSS3 & Bootstrap . Indesign Studio X work mainly with Shopify and are rated as the #2 Shopify expert.

Giants & Titans required an AngularJS web app for their haircare client Umberto Giannini. The project involved the build of a bespoke prize picker that could distribute prizes fairly between a varying number of final users. I built the project with using AngularJS , WordPress, AJAX , PHP , MySQL , HTML5 , CSS3 & Bootstrap.

I’ve worked on a number of projects with Planet-9. Most recently I was the sole developer on a project that delivered a competition using WordPress , HTML5 , CSS3 , Bootstrap , PHP , jQuery and MySQL to manage 70,000 unique prize codes, collect user info and provide a fully bespoke admin area . Planet-9 were impressed with my performance.

1HQ required final Photoshop designs to be created from wireframes that would be ideal for development with Bootstrap . The contract lasted for 2 weeks. 1HQ were pleased with the quality and speed of my work.

Over the winter of 2014/15 I worked freelance with my company Juicy Lemon Creative, building websites for businesses & entrepreneurs. Key skills included: WordPress , HTML5 , CSS3 , Bootstrap , PHP , jQuery , MySQL.

I was headhunted for my role at Shopify Builder where I enjoyed creating a range of bespoke eCommerce and WordPress sites, also using HTML5 , CSS3 , Bootstrap & PHP . Over time I became the lead JavaScript & jQuery developer, reducing the amount of outsourcing the company had to do.
I was part of and IT team that maintained 50 different eCommerce sites with total pageviews upwards of 1 million a month. Key skills: WordPress, PHP , MySQL , HTML5 , CSS3 & Bootstrap.

I worked as a front-end developer and designer , creating new WordPress integrated pages for the site, from the initial photoshop design to the final functional page.Key skills: WordPress, PHP , JavaScript , HTML5 , CSS3 & Bootstrap.

portfolio.description: This brand new Juicy Lemon Creative portfolio site is built with React, Vanilla JS and Firebase as an API, with a custom NodeJS API planned for the future.

The Sewing Quarter is a new TV shopping channel who’s website needed to be edited by stocking, PR and marketing departments. The site also needed to function an effective way to watch and buy with ease primarily from tablet and phone. WordPress was used as a CMS with a custom built theme to match given designs. AngularJS with web sockets were used to show items being used in the live stream, the item data and images were fed from a .net API.

Umberto Giannini were planning a Christmas prize giveaway offering their fans a chance to win products and salon experiences in their Birmingham and Manchester branches. The user entered their contact info and then proceeded to pull a slider across the screen that caused a cracker to shake and then explode. The project was built in AngularJS, using AJAX, PHP and MySQL to collect data, all housed within WordPress.

I created a cinema competition for Kumho Tyres that consisted of a details capture page (pictured) and also a bespoke admin area (for privacy reasons not pictured) that charts all prize-code redemptions by date or number and allows data export and import. The project managed 70,000 prize-codes to be given out at 126 stores.

When I was approached by Dine Birmingham they told me they wanted to move their existing site from Tumblr to WordPress, which was done with ease and with added functionality such as news and events carousels and a custom search function.

Dine Birmingham were concerned their SEO would be affected by the move, so a lot of care was taken to redirect all pages from the old Tumblr site to the new one. Viewership increased immediately after the new site launched and Dine Birmingham found that they received more partnership enquiries after going live.

"I commissioned a total site redesign and was incredibly happy with the final result – a professional and attractive website that began to bring in many more enquiries almost as soon as it launched. Throughout the process, service was friendly and accommodating, and I felt there was a real understanding of my needs as a client. I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend Juicy Lemon Creative to my friends and contacts. In fact I already have!" – Ahmed Ahmed, Dine Birmingham

Regal Gentleman needed a clean and professional design for their male grooming products website. The site was a brand new build, so building a site to properly reflect a band was essential.

Regal Gentleman are a company who are passionate about their products, and since the launch have been growing and making a name for themselves in the male grooming world.

Natas needed a site building from scratch that clearly displayed a lot of information and different product descriptions. They wanted a corporate feel to the work and needed to be able to update their site as their products change.

Muscle Fitness Factory had some very specific ideas for the look of their site. They supplied their own Photoshop files with the exact design they wanted. Their vision was quickly and accurately delivered. They have since enjoyed healthy sales and growth.

frontPage.paragraph: Juicy Lemon Creative is the portfolio of me, Liam Lewis. I'm a Front-End Web Developer with 5+ years professional experience working in varied environments including creative agency, corporate and freelance. I work as a contractor, usually in eCommerce, mainly using using React, AngularJS and WordPress (amongst others).
frontPage.skillsList: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript ES6, jQuery, ReactJS, NodeJS, AngularJS, WordPress, Bootstrap, AJAX, PHP, MySQL, SASS/LESS, Git, SVN, web and graphic design, cross-device & browser compatibility.
